channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: How some Iranians reacted to attacks on their country
item.description: What are people in Iran saying about today's attacks by the U.S. and Israel? We hear from people on the ground who experienced the event as it unfolded.
item.content:encoded: What are people in Iran saying about today's attacks by the U.S. and Israel? We hear from people on the ground who experienced the event as it unfolded.
item.dc:creator: Emily Kwong

item.title: House Dem. Leader Jeffries responds to air strikes on Iran by U.S. and Israel
item.description: NPR's Emily Kwong speaks to House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries (D-NY), who is still calling for a vote on a war powers resolution following a wave of U.S.- and Israel-led airstrikes on Iran.
item.content:encoded:
NPR's Emily Kwong speaks to House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries (D-NY), who is still calling for a vote on a war powers resolution following a wave of U.S.- and Israel-led airstrikes on Iran.

(Image credit: Win McNamee)
item.dc:creator: Emily Kwong

item.title: Retired Vice Admiral gives military perspective on US-Israel attacks on Iran
item.description: Robert Harward is a former U.S. Navy Seal who grew up in Iran and led operations in the region. He speaks with host Mary Louise Kelly about this moment and what it means.
item.content:encoded: Robert Harward is a former U.S. Navy Seal who grew up in Iran and led operations in the region. He speaks with host Mary Louise Kelly about this moment and what it means.
item.dc:creator: Mary Louise Kelly

item.title: Marco Rubio is pressing for change in Cuba. Will it work?
item.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio walks a diplomatic tightrope in the Caribbean, pressing for change in Cuba while regional leaders warn of a deepening humanitarian and migration crisis.
item.content:encoded: Secretary of State Marco Rubio walks a diplomatic tightrope in the Caribbean, pressing for change in Cuba while regional leaders warn of a deepening humanitarian and migration crisis.
item.dc:creator: Michele Kelemen

item.title: What's next after Iran attack? A former negotiator weighs in.
item.description: What will negotiations look like in the weeks after the U.S. and Israel's strikes on Iran? Robert Malley -- who was a lead negotiator on the 2015 Iran Nuclear deal -- offers some insight.
item.content:encoded: What will negotiations look like in the weeks after the U.S. and Israel's strikes on Iran? Robert Malley -- who was a lead negotiator on the 2015 Iran Nuclear deal -- offers some insight.
item.dc:creator: Emily Kwong

item.title: White House confirms death of Iran's Supreme Leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei
item.description: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei has been killed. He was 86 years old. Khamenei was unwavering in his steadfast antipathy to the US and Israel.
item.content:encoded: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei has been killed. He was 86 years old. Khamenei was unwavering in his steadfast antipathy to the US and Israel.
item.dc:creator: Jackie Northam

item.title: President Trump says Iran's Supreme Leader is dead. What happens now?
item.description: The United States and Israel launched military strikes against Iran overnight. NPR's Mary Louise Kelly discusses the attacks with NPR's Daniel Estrin and Greg Myre.
item.content:encoded: The United States and Israel launched military strikes against Iran overnight. NPR's Mary Louise Kelly discusses the attacks with NPR's Daniel Estrin and Greg Myre.
item.dc:creator: Mary Louise Kelly

item.title: New music Friday: Mitski's new album, 'Nothing's About to Happen to Me'
item.description: NPR's Ailsa Chang speaks with Raina Douris, host of World Cafe at member station WXPN, about Mitski's new album, Nothing's About to Happen to Me.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ailsa Chang speaks with Raina Douris, host of World Cafe at member station WXPN, about Mitski's new album, Nothing's About to Happen to Me.
item.dc:creator: Michael Levitt

item.title: Populism is dominating politics right now
item.description: Republicans and Democrats are embracing their own takes on populism to respond to shifting politics in the country.
item.content:encoded: Republicans and Democrats are embracing their own takes on populism to respond to shifting politics in the country.
item.dc:creator: Domenico Montanaro

item.title: Australia says no to returning citizens with alleged ISIS ties from Syria
item.description: In Australia, the attempted return of people with alleged links to the Islamic State has raised questions about who bears responsibility for nationals who traveled overseas to join the Islamic State.
item.content:encoded: In Australia, the attempted return of people with alleged links to the Islamic State has raised questions about who bears responsibility for nationals who traveled overseas to join the Islamic State.
item.dc:creator: Kristina Kukolja
